wheel_controller.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 """!@brief WheelController module for the robot_sim car.
4 
5 @details Since Gazebo is not able to simulate closed kinematic chains and a real Ackermann drive can't be implemented,
6 this controller simulates a virtual Ackermann drive instead. The controller takes commands from the "/cmd_vel" topic,
7 translates them into the respective commands for each individual joint and sends them to the car's controller
8 interfaces. This of course assumes that both rear wheels and the steering for each front wheel can be controller
9 individually.
10 
11 @file wheel_controller.py Wheel controller file for the robot_sim package.
12 
13 @author Martin Schuck
14 
15 @date 19.09.2020
16 """
17 
18 import numpy as np
19 
20 import rospy
21 from geometry_msgs.msg import Twist
22 from std_msgs.msg import Float64
23 
24 
25 class WheelController:
26  """!@brief Contains the virtual Ackermann drive logic.
27 
28  @details Car parameters are hard coded. Commands are assumed to be received from the "/cmd_vel" topic. The
29  controller tries to match the frequency of the velocity command topic and should be capable of > 1kHz.
30 
31  @warning The controller uses a speed modifier for car speed translation. This will not match the speed command. This is
32  done for convenient car speed in the simulation. If you need exact velocity commands, please modify the
33  speed_modifier to match the robot's true conversion factor.
34  """
35  def __init__(self):
36  """!@brief WheelController constructor.
37 
38  @details Initializes hard coded car parameters and the subscriber/publishers.
39  """
40  self.max_speed = 5.0
41  self.speed_modifier = 70
42  self.max_wheel_angle = 0.36
43  self.car_width = 0.38378
44  self.car_length = 0.35873
45  self.vel_cmd_listener = rospy.Subscriber("/cmd_vel", Twist, self._cmd_callback)
46  self.rf_wheel_publisher = rospy.Publisher("/tas_car/wheel_rf_controller/command", Float64, queue_size=1)
47  self.lf_wheel_publisher = rospy.Publisher("/tas_car/wheel_lf_controller/command", Float64, queue_size=1)
48  self.rb_wheel_publisher = rospy.Publisher("/tas_car/wheel_rb_controller/command", Float64, queue_size=1)
49  self.lb_wheel_publisher = rospy.Publisher("/tas_car/wheel_lb_controller/command", Float64, queue_size=1)
50 
51  @staticmethod
52  def start():
53  """!@brief Starts the WheelController.
54 
55  @details Initializes the ROS node and keeps the node spinning.
56  """
57  rospy.init_node('wheel_controller', anonymous=True)
58  rospy.loginfo('Started virtual ackermann drive controller.')
59  rospy.spin()
60 
61  def _cmd_callback(self, twist):
62  """!@brief Callback for the "/cmd_vel" topic subscriber.
63 
64  @details Acts as a wrapper to the geometry logic responsible for translating the commands into target values.
65  Publishes to all controllers once calculations are finished.
66 
67  @param twist Twist message received from the velocity command subscriber.
68 
69  @note Velocities will not match the exact command. Uses a simple speed modifier to translate the desired
70  velocity into angular velocity for the joint. Speed modifier is chosen for convenient car speed in the
71  simulation.
72  """
73  angle = twist.angular.z
74  velocity = twist.linear.x
75  if velocity < 0:
76  angle *= -1 # Convert angle to geometric angle in case of negative velocity.
77  lf_angle, rf_angle, corrected_angle = self._calculate_wheel_steering(angle)
78  lb_velocity, rb_velocity = self._calculate_wheel_velocity(velocity, corrected_angle)
79  self.rf_wheel_publisher.publish(rf_angle)
80  self.lf_wheel_publisher.publish(lf_angle)
81  self.rb_wheel_publisher.publish(-rb_velocity * self.speed_modifier) # Wheels turn the other way around in sim.
82  self.lb_wheel_publisher.publish(-lb_velocity * self.speed_modifier)
83 
84  def _calculate_wheel_steering(self, angle):
85  """!@brief Calculates the steering angle of the right and left front wheel.
86 
87  @details Angles are computed according to the Ackermann model. Angles are further limited to the maximum
88  steering angle the robot allows for.
89 
90  @param angle The desired turning angle for the robot.
91 
92  @return Returns the angles for both front wheels as well as the commanded angle. The initial angle gets modified
93  to the highest achievable angle in case the command violated car constraints.
94  """
95  if angle == 0:
96  return 0, 0, 0
97  radius = self.car_length/np.tan(abs(angle))
98  sign = 1 if angle > 0 else -1
99  lf_angle = sign * np.arctan(self.car_length/(radius - sign * (self.car_width/2)))
100  rf_angle = sign * np.arctan(self.car_length/(radius + sign * (self.car_width/2)))
101  lf_angle, rf_angle, angle = self._limit_angle(lf_angle, rf_angle, angle)
102  return lf_angle, rf_angle, angle
103 
104  def _calculate_wheel_velocity(self, velocity, angle):
105  """!@brief Calculates the rear wheel velocity.
106 
107  @details Velocities are computed according to the Ackermann model. Velocities are further limited to the maximum
108  velocity the robot allows for.
109 
110  @param velocity The desired velocity for the robot.
111  @param angle The desired turning angle for the robot.
112 
113  @return Returns the velocities for both rear wheels.
114  """
115  if angle == 0:
116  return min(velocity, self.max_speed), min(velocity, self.max_speed)
117  radius = self.car_length/np.tan(abs(angle))
118  sign = 1 if angle > 0 else -1
119  lb_velocity = velocity * (1 - sign * self.car_length/(2*radius))
120  rb_velocity = velocity * (1 + sign * self.car_length/(2*radius))
121  lb_velocity, rb_velocity = self._limit_velocity(lb_velocity, rb_velocity)
122  return lb_velocity, rb_velocity
123 
124  def _limit_angle(self, lf_angle, rf_angle, angle):
125  """!@brief Limits the steering angle of the right and left front wheel.
126 
127  @details Only modifies the values in case of a violation of the maximum allowable angles.
128 
129  @param lf_angle The left front wheel angle computed from the velocity command.
130  @param rf_angle The right front wheel angle computed from the velocity command.
131  @param angle The desired turning angle for the robot.
132 
133  @return Returns the angles for both front wheels as well as the commanded angle. The initial angle gets modified
134  to the highest achievable angle in case the command violated car constraints.
135  """
136  if lf_angle > self.max_wheel_angle:
137  lf_angle = self.max_wheel_angle
138  radius = self.car_length/np.tan(lf_angle) + self.car_width/2
139  angle = np.arctan(self.car_length/radius)
140  rf_angle = np.arctan(self.car_length/(radius + self.car_width/2))
141  elif rf_angle < -self.max_wheel_angle:
142  rf_angle = -self.max_wheel_angle
143  radius = self.car_length/np.tan(abs(rf_angle)) + self.car_width/2
144  angle = -np.arctan(self.car_length/(radius + self.car_width/2))
145  lf_angle = -np.arctan(self.car_length/(radius + self.car_width/2))
146  return lf_angle, rf_angle, angle
147 
148  def _limit_velocity(self, lb_velocity, rb_velocity):
149  """!@brief Limits the velocities of the right and left rear wheel.
150 
151  @details Only modifies the values in case of a violation of the maximum allowable velocity.
152 
153  @param lb_velocity The left rear wheel velocity computed from the velocity command.
154  @param rb_velocity The right rear wheel velocity computed from the velocity command.
155 
156  @return Returns the velocities for both rear wheels.
157  """
158  frac = 1
159  if abs(lb_velocity) > abs(rb_velocity) and abs(lb_velocity) > self.max_speed:
160  frac = self.max_speed/abs(lb_velocity)
161  elif abs(rb_velocity) > abs(lb_velocity) and abs(rb_velocity) > self.max_speed:
162  frac = self.max_speed/abs(rb_velocity)
163  return lb_velocity*frac, rb_velocity*frac
164 
165 
166 if __name__ == '__main__':
167  wheel_controller = WheelController()
168  wheel_controller.start()
